_template_notes._overview: This template defines the structure for topic JSON files used by the Dynamic Learning Check-in app.
_template_notes.id: Unique identifier for this topic, used for storing progress. Use kebab-case (e.g., 'linear-equations-year9').
_template_notes.name: Display name shown in the topic selector dropdown.
_template_notes.subject: The subject area (Mathematics, Science, English, etc.)
_template_notes.yearLevel: Year level as displayed (Year 7, Year 9, VCE Unit 3, etc.)
_template_notes.class: The class code that will auto-populate in settings (e.g., '9A Mathematics')
_template_notes.description: Brief 1-2 sentence overview shown in the topic header area
_template_notes.subtopics: Array of subtopic sections. Each subtopic groups related learning items.
_template_notes.subtopic.id: Unique identifier for this subtopic within the topic (kebab-case)
_template_notes.subtopic.name: Display name for the subtopic section
_template_notes.subtopic.icon: Emoji icon displayed next to subtopic name (e.g., üìê üìä üìà üî¢ üí°)
_template_notes.subtopic.what: 2-3 sentence explanation for the 'What is this section' expandable panel
_template_notes.subtopic.why: 2-3 sentence explanation for the 'Why does it matter' expandable panel
_template_notes.item.id: Unique numeric ID for this learning item (must be unique across ALL subtopics in the topic)
_template_notes.item.title: The 'I can...' statement - a specific, measurable learning intention
_template_notes.item.code: Reference code shown next to the item (e.g., '1.1', '2.3', or curriculum codes)
_template_notes.item.what: 1-2 sentence explanation shown in the 'What Why Example' panel
_template_notes.item.why: 1-2 sentence explanation of why this matters
_template_notes.item.example: A concrete, specific example with real numbers or scenarios
_template_notes.questions: Quiz questions for level-up verification. Object with keys toLevel2, toLevel3, toLevel4, toLevel5.
_template_notes.questions.toLevelX: Array of questions for advancing to level X. Empty array [] means no quiz required for that transition.

question_structure.question: The question text. Should directly test the learning intention.
question_structure.correct: The single correct answer (will be shuffled with distractors).
question_structure.correctExplanation: Brief explanation shown when student answers correctly.
question_structure.distractors: Array of exactly 3 incorrect options, each with 'answer' and 'explanation' fields.
question_structure.distractor.answer: A plausible but incorrect answer that addresses a common misconception.
question_structure.distractor.explanation: Explanation shown when student selects this wrong answer - should clarify the misconception.

question_guidelines.quantity: Aim for 10 questions per level transition. Questions are presented randomly without repetition until all are used.
question_guidelines.difficulty: toLevel2 = basic recall, toLevel3 = understanding, toLevel4 = application, toLevel5 = mastery/teaching level
question_guidelines.distractors: Each distractor should represent a realistic mistake or misconception, not obviously wrong answers.
question_guidelines.explanations: Keep explanations concise (1-2 sentences). Focus on correcting the specific error.

_template_notes._note: Remove this entire _template_notes section when creating actual topic files.
